main event: On July 3, 1966, multiple observers in West Jefferson, Ohio, reported seeing a light that appeared to be on fire, which was consistent with a cast air balloon.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a round shape and was as large as a house, which would make it over 100 feet wide., The sighting lasted approximately 25 minutes., Observers noted that the object moved in front of clouds and did not disappear while they were watching it., The object was brighter than the brightest stars and emitted no sound., The report concluded that the object may have been misidentified as unauthorized fireworks.
sighted object: light resembling a fire on a balloon
witness description: male, additional witnesses were noted but not confirmed
